Package common.controllers

Class ScoreFileProcesser

java.lang.Object
common.controllers.ScoreFileProcesser
public class ScoreFileProcesser
extends java.lang.Object
This class provides static methods to access to local score file and write to local score file.

To prevent duplicate instances of this class, it is set to Singleton. Every scene is able to access to this class and get corresponging information.

  • Field Summary

    Fields

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static ScoreFileProcesser getInstance()
      Gets ScoreFileProcesser Singleton.
      Returns:
      Singleton instance of ScoreFileProcesser, if it is not instantialized, creates one

    • getScoreList

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getScoreList()
      Gets the score list.
      Returns:
      Singleton instance of score list, if it is not instantialized, creates one

    • getNameList

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getNameList()
      Gets the name list.
      Returns:
      Singleton instance of name list, if it is not instantialized, creates one

    • readScore

      public void readScore()
      Reads local score file and saves information about score and names into score list and name list.

      If there is no record in score file, saves nothing into two lists (null).

    • processList

      public static void processList​(java.lang.String name, int score)
      Compares the score with static score list, if the score is ranked to be top 10, add it to the array list.

      If there is more than 10 records after addition, delete the last one.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of current player
      score - the score of current player

    • updateFile

      private static void updateFile​(java.lang.String filePath)
      Writes new score list and new name list into local score file.
      Parameters:
      filePath - file path to local score file, 'Score.txt'

    • getFilePath

      public static java.lang.String getFilePath()

    • setFilePath

      public void setFilePath​(java.lang.String filePath)
